This is needed so much!!!
My friends and I switched to realms and we keep getting lost because of it. It is driving us nuts.
The fog can also be taxing on performance.

I came here to post this suggestion, I had a feeling someone else has the same pain. I suspect that shared worlds would be difficult because of the way consoles(ps4) separate different users data. But why must the active profile be player 1, or be a player at all? All the worlds could be created on the same profile and some management on how players join. Though on PS4, only 4 ps4 accounts can be logged in at once so 4 players playing on the account of the person who isn't there wouldn't work because it would require 5 ps4 profiles logged in. If there is a way to make it happen I hope that they will consider implementing it. 4 player split screen on Windows would be great too then I could ditch the console but that's for another thread.
It honestly is a nuisance. The workaround I found was joining the realm via the generated invite link which you can share.

i agree

minecraft is an awesome game for kids. but some servers and realms are not appropriate for kids

we pay for a realm for my son and his friends but in order to allow realm access you end up allowing access to potentially all realms worldwide. another friend of ours runs his on server on his dad’s linux server but there no way to control which servers a kid can access.

the xbox live parental controls are basically junk and do not offer the granularity needed and the user interface is horrendous.

we would like a way in the minecraft app for iOS to improve child online protections by doing the following;

1) allow customization of the server list in app and allow an in app password to be set by a parent to prevent list from changing or going directly to a server not on the list

2) provide a mechanism to control via an in app password which realms a child can go to

Just just make the controls in-game and don’t let us spend an entire month trying to go inside.

I spent a day alone trying to add my dad to my family group.

agree the parental control system is bl00dy awful - this from a nintendo switch parent - i don't know how many times i've been to that flamin aka.ms/accountsettings page.. but despite following the instructions to the letter repeatedly, it *just doesn't work*.. i surrendered and created a flock of xbox accounts for the kids ages ago and that was a total headache also.. i should add i have been an IT professional for years, written kernel code and debugged networks - this stuff has me completely defeated..
That is very hard

I'd like this feature to determine who is griefing.  The backup on my realm before and after show only a single player who moved, and so they're the ones who did it.  Who is it?  I can't tell.  Got the unique id and everything, but can't really do anything with it.  I need this ability to admin my realm better.

I'm currently editing my survival world and looking through inventory's for no reason. its hard to tell who is who, and there's a handful of players that I was able to judge by tool names, but other than that I can't tell who is who out of 30-50+ players
I totally agree with that. It's possible on PC, why not on Xbox? If you want to be restrictive, add a toggle switch in the options for that button.

this feature is way over due. I have a bedrock dedicated server. And I'm able to connect to it by the add server on the windows 10 and android version of bedrock. But my friend that has a Xbox one x or my other friend that has ps4 cant join because they don't have that setting. They only was is with windows 10, android and mobile ios. This would make alike of people happier especially right now with the whole corona thing going on.

I run my own server and I see this issue when my friends try to connect to it. they are only tempted with a Unable to Connect to Server, but for some reason I can still connect even when I don't use the LAN option. It would be nice to see a Add Server Button that isn't hard to use.

Yes! As somebody who is a moderator of a community that relies on realms, this would be extremely helpful! Currently fed up with the realm owner paying $10.99 just to have a water-downed server panel. I don't understand what Mojang were thinking when it came to competing with other server hosting providers when their own service can't offer the basic necessities a server owner would need. I would honestly pay an additional $10 to realms just to have any slight amount of control over a realm, and I'm sure everyone else would too.
This sounds like a wonderful idea, they have it on the Java versions. What can we do to get it migrated to the BDS
Yes please. Why wouldn't this already be in realms?

Clarified subject to help search results.

Thanks for your contribution.
Yeah we definitely need to be allowed to transfer from system to system for FREE. I can't stress that enough.

It's crazy because we already have to pay again for each platform we download on, but then when you try to play a world on your mobile that you play on your console you can't without paying, and then you also need a solid internet connection. I play on Xbox but often travel and want to take my world with me. All worlds are already saved online as well as on the Xbox, so just give us the option to upload and download the worlds across devices. At the very least, we should have an option to save a world to OneDrive or the likes and an easy, in game way to download your uploaded world onto each device when you want to play it.

Or even just build an option within the edit world options beside copy and delete to upload world. Then you can search for cloud worlds on your other device and download them, similar to what you do if you want an old version world to go to bedrock. All versions store worlds online already over an internet connection so you can play them on the same account when using a different but same type of device (eg 2 different xboxes or switches)
i want it
Yes, I think everyone would love to have this feature.
This would make it so much easier to set up servers.
Bedrock dosent use P2P multiplayer it just basicly uses the open to lan button and adds upnp based on what i understand (its not p2p as it still uses the entrailsed server architecture)
Console player cannot add servers, we need to use other apps in other devices that strugles our experience at the moment we join into servers we want
needs to be done
pls add the button, its only for play my servers
mojang adiciona novos servers no  minecraft nos consoles

This needs to happen. It would be especially helpful for those building communities and that are capable of running their own dedicated servers. Having to leave a device logged into a world 24/7 just so others can join is not practical, because it pauses the world and does not allow others to join if the host has the game paused or running in the background. Playing your own world offers 8 player slots, and a realm only offers 10, so paying for a realm is not plausible at the extra cost. Especially when a dedicated server on a really good internet connection could easily handle 20+ players at one time.

PC users have a button in the Servers tab to "Add Server", and it should be present on all devices/consoles. This suggestion is three years old at this point and is becoming more and more relevant for many players in this era, but not enough people know to come here to make suggestions like this.

Developers can use the same concept for this as is available to PC users at no additional impact other than making it noted to users on certain devices if their device is not compatible with the add-ons included on that dedicated server.

Clone of: https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/360047514492--Java-Edition-Performance-Enhancements-For-Minecraft-Servers-Multithreading-

(actually others too, but this is the most famous)
yes please !
And bring back the ability to purchase Bedrock Realms in 6 month increments. Why they took that away is beyond me.

for realms you already need a console subscription if you are playing on that. i say make it a one time payment forever.

This can be done with any ol' world though, just have the owner open a world, have those they want to be able to play with on their friends list, then their friends can join whenever they want as long as the host has kept their device and world running. It's a nice idea, but can technically already be done by simply opening a world and leaving it there.
If the owner just open the world for everyone, then the owner's tablet or computer will just ran out of battery?

Also…Keep your eyes and ears open. We have more Preview Realms news coming soon. *The render distance experienced in a Realm will always be either your device maximum or the Realms render distance value, whichever is lower. **One free preview Realm is available for each paid Realms subscription you have.

Java players, we have not forgotten you. While this change is only for Bedrock Preview/Beta Realms currently, we are actively investigating what improvements can be made for Java Realms view distance.

Hey!
Is there any way to change the render distance on Java realm?
A maximum of your device’s render distance would be better, plus at least 20 chunks. Your render distance would be handled by the client only.

If you guys are after money to support the architecture just put a higher premium on the realm with a much higher render distance. Bundle it with higher player count. With the increased revenue you might be able to offer small 2 player realms with standard rendering for free. That might entice people to get a realm if they haven't already. They only reason my realms are closed is because of the player count and render distances.

Hope you guys figure something out!

Much love~ <3
I feel like the render distance is now really low. The nether is so hard to traverse with a low render distance. If we had an option to pay for high render distance I would.
What is the purpose of relms?  I am new to bedrock as I was on legasy for about 7 years.  This post was harsh but to the point.
Being able to pay ahead when you can is always nice, so the 3 month and 6 month Realm plans need to come back.
This needs to come back. It's much better to pay in one bigger payment.

I will not be doing monthly payments either. It seems that these days we have to 'rent' everything. I know the 6 month sub is still renting but at a bit of discount. I guess like many software packages these days you pay for them to 'keep updating'. I was sure that the Java edition can get 6 monthly (I could be wrong).
I agree the option needs to be returned
